quotes.text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
quotes.author: John Johnson

quotes.text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
quotes.author: Cory House

quotes.text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
quotes.author: Kent Beck

quotes.text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
quotes.author: Harold Abelson

quotes.text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuchs

quotes.text: The most damaging phrase in the language is 'We've always done it this way'.
quotes.author: Grace Hopper

quotes.text: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
quotes.author: Burt Rutan

quotes.text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
quotes.author: Martin Fowler

quotes.text: The best way to predict the future is to implement it.
quotes.author: David Heinemeier Hansson

quotes.text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
quotes.author: Dan Salomon

quotes.text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
quotes.author: Louis Srygley

quotes.text: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.
quotes.author: Chris Heilmann

quotes.text: It's not a bug – it's an undocumented feature.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
quotes.author: Doug Linder

quotes.text: Don't comment bad code - rewrite it.
quotes.author: Brian Kernighan

quotes.text: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
quotes.author: Chris Pine

quotes.text: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
quotes.author: Dennis Ritchie

quotes.text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
quotes.author: Grady Booch

quotes.text: Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares.
quotes.author: Robert C. Martin

quotes.text: Programming is the art of algorithm design and the craft of debugging errant code.
quotes.author: Ellen Ullman

quotes.text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
quotes.author: Ralph Johnson

quotes.text: Software and cathedrals are much the same – first we build them, then we pray.
quotes.author: Sam Redwine

quotes.text: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third works.
quotes.author: Alan J. Perlis

quotes.text: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quotes.text: The best method for accelerating a computer is the one that boosts it by 9.8 m/s².
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
quotes.author: Donald Knuth

quotes.text: Programming is not about typing, it's about thinking.
quotes.author: Rich Hickey

quotes.text: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
quotes.author: Ron Jeffries

quotes.text: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
quotes.author: C.A.R. Hoare
